channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Gymnast Jordan Chiles appeals to Swiss supreme court for her Olympic bronze medal
item.description: Chiles was awarded the bronze medal at the Paris floor exercise final. But her medal was revoked by an arbitration court, which ruled an inquiry that had improved her score was filed seconds too late.
item.content:encoded:
Chiles was awarded the bronze medal at the Paris floor exercise final. But her medal was revoked by an arbitration court, which ruled an inquiry that had improved her score was filed seconds too late.

(Image credit: Naomi Baker)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: These states will decide the election. We went to all of them to talk to voters
item.description: Your guide to the six swing states that will decide this year’s presidential election: Georgia, Nevada, Wisconsin, Michigan, Arizona and Pennsylvania.
item.content:encoded: Your guide to the six swing states that will decide this year’s presidential election: Georgia, Nevada, Wisconsin, Michigan, Arizona and Pennsylvania.
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: In France, A Shocking Story and Difficult Questions About Society
item.description: A rape case in France involving a woman whose ex-husband is on trial for drugging her and recruiting other men to sexually assault her. Now thousands have turned out to support her and many are asking hard questions about the culture that allowed this to happen for years.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

A rape case in France involving a woman whose ex-husband is on trial for drugging her and recruiting other men to sexually assault her. Now thousands have turned out to support her and many are asking hard questions about the culture that allowed this to happen for years.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: The Boeing Strike: 4 moments the company fractured its bond with workers
item.description: Though contract negotiations were the catalyst for Boeing machinists to go on strike, frustrations among workers have been building up for years.
item.content:encoded:
Though contract negotiations were the catalyst for Boeing machinists to go on strike, frustrations among workers have been building up for years.

(Image credit: John Froschauer)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: TikTok argued against its U.S. ban in court today. Here's what happened
item.description: TikTok’s survival in the U.S. is riding on the outcome of the hearing. Federal judges peppered both the Justice Department and TikTok with skeptical questions about the ban, which takes effect in January.
item.content:encoded:
TikTok’s survival in the U.S. is riding on the outcome of the hearing. Federal judges peppered both the Justice Department and TikTok with skeptical questions about the ban, which takes effect in January.

(Image credit: Matt Slocum/AP)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Here's everything we know about the apparent assassination attempt on Trump
item.description: The suspect "didn’t even get close to getting a round off," and never had a line of sight on Trump, authorities said. Ryan Wesley Routh is facing federal gun-related charges in the incident.
item.content:encoded:
The suspect "didn’t even get close to getting a round off," and never had a line of sight on Trump, authorities said. Ryan Wesley Routh is facing federal gun-related charges in the incident.

(Image credit: Lynne Sladky)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: China frees American pastor after 18 years in detention
item.description: The State Department said that 68-year-old David Lin is coming home after being arrested in China on vague contract charges that he and his family deny. He had been jailed there for 18 years.
item.content:encoded:
The State Department said that 68-year-old David Lin is coming home after being arrested in China on vague contract charges that he and his family deny. He had been jailed there for 18 years.

(Image credit: Wang Zhao)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: What we know about the suspect in the Trump apparent assassination attempt
item.description: Ryan Wesley Routh's digital footprint paints a picture of a disillusioned former Trump supporter who took up an impassioned defense of Ukraine. Here's what else we know about the 58-year-old suspect.
item.content:encoded:
Ryan Wesley Routh's digital footprint paints a picture of a disillusioned former Trump supporter who took up an impassioned defense of Ukraine. Here's what else we know about the 58-year-old suspect.

(Image credit: AFPTV)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 2nd apparent assassination attempt on Trump: Everything we know so far
item.description: The FBI is investigating a second apparent assassination attempt of former President Donald Trump Sunday. The gunman was about 300 to 500 yards from Trump with an AK-style rifle with scope.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI is investigating a second apparent assassination attempt of former President Donald Trump Sunday. The gunman was about 300 to 500 yards from Trump with an AK-style rifle with scope.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: A celestial trifecta: What to know about Tuesday’s lunar eclipse
item.description: This month's harvest moon will not only coincide with a supermoon, but also with a blood moon and partial lunar eclipse.
item.content:encoded:
This month's harvest moon will not only coincide with a supermoon, but also with a blood moon and partial lunar eclipse.

(Image credit: Dan Peled)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster
